entries.title: Quark Cohort Dossier
body: Up, down, and heavy flavour quarks all carry fractional colour charge. They never appear alone; gluon exchange stitches trios into baryons or pairs into mesons.
In combat that translates to tether play. Gluon Bind and Baryon Wall let coordinated squads negate Magnetic Traps by keeping colour balanced across the team.
entries.highlight: Quark squads juggle colour charge to weave baryon shields that shrug off Magnetic Trap shears.

entries.title: Lepton Mobility Brief
body: Leptons ignore the strong force entirely, interacting only via electromagnetism and the weak interaction. Their masses span orders of magnitude but their singlet nature keeps them free of colour tethers.
The kit emphasises evasion—Photon Dash and Phase Shift let them ghost through Charged Fields, while Ghost Walk ensures neutrinos slip past detection.
entries.highlight: Leptons' lack of colour charge keeps them fluid through Charged Field mazes while Photon Dash burns energy lanes.

entries.title: Gauge Boson Field Notes
body: Photons, gluons, and weak bosons are the actual force messengers. Their integer spin lets them stack in the same state, which the roster captures with support auras and overlapping pulses.
Gamma Burst and Weak Charge Field translate theoretical fields into massive plays, while Higgs Mass Boost lets squads weather reactor rooms despite rising flux.
entries.highlight: Gauge bosons reshape arenas with Weak Charge Field pulses that stabilise teams around reactor hazards.

entries.title: Alkali Reactivity Log
body: Lithium, sodium, and potassium shed their outer electron eagerly. That rapid oxidation explains their fragile armour and explosive surges.
Timing Chain Discharge bursts before a Chemical Vat splash keeps the team alive—Ion Field pickups buy a few seconds of stability.
entries.highlight: Alkali metals hold a single valence electron, so Chain Discharge surges while Chemical Vats threaten catastrophic runaway.

entries.title: Alkaline Earth Stabiliser Brief
body: Magnesium and calcium lose two electrons to reach noble stability, so they prefer building structures over explosive plays.
Mass Anchor and Neutral Screen distribute that stability to allies, countering Molecule Crafter puzzles with reliable scaffolding.
entries.highlight: Doubly charged lattices steady Inertial Field bulwarks that shrug off Molecule Crafter disruptions.

entries.title: Chalcogen Catalyst Notes
body: Oxygen and sulphur bond readily, acting as oxidisers and breath carriers. Their kits emphasise sustain and fire synergy.
Orbital Strike pairs with support oxygenate loops, yet you must vent Chemical Vats before the atmosphere spikes beyond control.
entries.highlight: Chalcogens fuel combustion and orbital strikes, but Chemical Vats can tip their oxidisers into runaway feed.

entries.title: Halogen Corrosion Report
body: Fluorine, chlorine, and iodine hunger for a single electron. Their affinity makes them vicious debuffers with potent area denial.
Halogen Corrosion and Chain Discharge combo with Chemical Vat spills, forcing opponents to flee poisoned terrain.
entries.highlight: Halogens rip electrons apart, letting Halogen Corrosion shred armour while Chemical Vats amplify toxicity.

entries.title: Noble Gas Field Manual
body: Helium, neon, and argon sport full valence shells. They scarcely react, making them perfect for insulation and crowd calming.
Their Noble Gas Barrier and Refraction Cloak tools nullify Electric Field arcs while levitation auras reposition allies.
entries.highlight: Inert shells resist reactions, so Noble Gas Barrier keeps Electric Fields from ionising your squad.

entries.title: Transition Metal Metallurgy Brief
body: Iron, copper, and gold exploit partially filled d-shells for bonding variety, conductivity, and magnetism.
Color Field and Mass Anchor style abilities let them manipulate Magnetic Traps, turning hazards into capture tools.
entries.highlight: Transition metals channel d-shell electrons into Magnetic Control grabs that tame Magnetic Traps.

entries.title: Radioactive Chain Reaction Log
body: Thorium and uranium undergo spontaneous decay, releasing ionising radiation. Their kits trade survivability for apocalyptic range.
Beta Cascade detonations must be timed to clear Radiation Zones or Fission Reactor surges before the fallout backfires.
entries.highlight: Radioactive metals bleed energy; Beta Cascade and Weak Flux vent core heat before Radiation Zones overwhelm shielding.
